title: Science Latest
description: Channel Description

title: Scientists Have Discovered a New Set of Blood Groups
description: The ‘Er’ grouping could help doctors identify and treat some rare cases of blood incompatibility, including between pregnant mothers and fetuses.
media:keywords: medicine, health, healthcare
dc:creator: Chris Baraniuk
dc:subject: In That Vein

title: The Mediterranean Sea Is So Hot, It’s Forming Carbonate Crystals
description: In the rapidly warming Eastern Mediterranean, water stratifies into layers, like a cake. That’s allowing carbon-spewing crystals to form.
media:keywords: climate change, oceans, Chemistry
dc:creator: Matt Simon
dc:subject: Climate Change

title: A Huge New Data Set Pushes the Limits of Neuroscience
description: The Allen Institute’s release includes recordings from a whopping 300,000 mouse neurons. Now the challenge is figuring out what to do with all that data.
media:keywords: Neuroscience, neural networks, Brains and Behavior, brains, Biology, animal behavior, big data
dc:creator: Grace Huckins
dc:subject: Neurons

title: US Cities Are Recycling Trees and Poop to Make Compost
description: Wood and biosolids from water treatment plants can be used to improve the soil—and keep remaining trees healthy.
media:keywords: environment, Cities, climate change, Infrastructure
dc:creator: Bryn Nelson
dc:subject: Crowdsourced

title: Self-Taught AI May Have a Lot in Common With the Human Brain
description: Neural networks can use self-supervised learning to figure out what matters. This process might be what helps humans do the same.
media:keywords: Quanta Magazine, artificial intelligence, neural networks, machine learning, Neuroscience, Brains and Behavior
dc:creator: Anil Ananthaswamy
dc:subject: Neuroscience

title: The Drying Up of Europe’s Great Rivers Could Be the New Normal
description: From the Danube to the Loire, these lifelines for the continent’s economy are running low after five months of brutal drought and years of dry weather.
media:keywords: Climate Desk, climate change, climate, water, rivers, environment, Ecology, drought
dc:creator: Paul Hockenos
dc:subject: Running Low

title: The Problem With Mental Health Bots
description: With human therapists in short supply, AI chatbots are trying to plug the gap—but it’s not clear how well they work.
media:keywords: mental health, psychology, artificial intelligence, bots, Apps, Bots Run the Internet
dc:creator: Grace Browne
dc:subject: Bots Run the Web

title: Sofia, the Airplane-Borne Telescope, Lands for the Last Time
description: Astronomers mourn the end of an infrared observatory that flew aboard a jumbo jet. It was expensive, but it saw what Earth-based telescopes can’t.
media:keywords: NASA, Astronomy, Aircraft, telescopes, space, Hubble, James Webb Space Telescope
dc:creator: Ramin Skibba
dc:subject: You’re Grounded

title: The Future of Climate Activism Is Intergenerational—and on TikTok
description: At RE:WIRED Green, scientist Sylvia Earle and climate activist Sophia Kianni discussed ways younger and older generations can work together to face the crisis.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, science, climate
dc:creator: Angela Watercutter
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: Colette Pichon Battle’s Plea for Climate Justice From the US Gulf
description: In the closing session of Re:WIRED GREEN, the Louisiana lawyer urged the audience to join the front lines of climate activism.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, climate change, climate, activism
dc:creator: Kate Knibbs
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: Alan Ahn Says Nuclear Is Still the Carbon-Free Fuel of the Future
description: The RE:WIRED Green speaker explains how smaller, more efficient reactors will be the bedrock of energy independence.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, Energy, nuclear power
dc:creator: Gregory Barber
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: Patricia Hidalgo-Gonzalez Wants to Strengthen the Grid
description: The UC San Diego researcher spoke at RE:WIRED Green about ways to use advanced control theory and machine learning to maximize sustainable energy sources.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, science, Energy
dc:creator: Max G. Levy
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: Stephen Palumbi Says ‘Super Reefs’ Can Help Save Dying Coral
description: The marine biologist told RE:WIRED Green about his team’s work to breed heat-resistant coral that can continue to support vibrant aquatic ecosystems.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, oceans, environment, Corals
dc:creator: Gregory Barber
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: Hurricane Ian Is a Warning From the Future
description: Tropical storms are increasingly likely to batter the US as oceans warm—and will continue to wreak havoc so long as climate change remains unaddressed.
media:keywords: climate, environment, hurricanes, weather
dc:creator: Meghan Herbst
dc:subject: Climate Change

title: The Era of Fast, Cheap Genome Sequencing Is Here
description: Illumina just announced a machine that can crack genomes twice as fast as its current version—and drive the cost down to $200 a pop.
media:keywords: DNA, whole-genome sequencing, Genomics, genetics, personal genomics, biotech, Biology, health
dc:creator: Emily Mullin
dc:subject: Speed Read

title: Climate Change Is Burying Archaeological Sites Under Tons of Sand
description: Desertification can wear down ancient ruins or hide them under dunes—leaving researchers scrambling to keep track of where they’re buried.
media:keywords: archaeology, climate change, environment
dc:creator: Charlie Metcalfe
dc:subject: Hide and Seek

title: Climate Justice Is Possible—Just Look Beyond Technology
description: At RE:WIRED Green, technologists, hackers, and activists explained how green tech must be combined with bold policy and bring people together.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, climate, recycling, sustainability
dc:creator: Gregory Barber
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: The Sustainable Future of Food Must Bring Everyone to the Table
description: At this year’s RE:WIRED Green event, food scientists and environmental justice activists mapped out how we can end world hunger and preserve our planet.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, food, environment, climate change, agriculture
dc:creator: Max G. Levy
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: ‘We Are the Asteroid’: The Case for Hope Amid Climate Fears
description: During the first session of Re:WIRED GREEN, experts laid out their vision for maintaining hope in the face of unprecedented challenges to our planet.
media:keywords: climate change, oceans, Geology, marine science, environment, RE:WIRED Green
dc:creator: Justin Pot
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green

title: At RE:WIRED Green, We’re Innovating to Fight the Climate Crisis
description: Our San Francisco event brings together scientists, entrepreneurs, and more to spotlight ways that human ingenuity can save the planet.
media:keywords: RE:WIRED Green, climate change, environment, sustainability, climate
dc:creator: Alan Henry
dc:subject: RE:WIRED Green
